Description: Rim and body sherd of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; sharp offset on inside; interior: reserved band at top of rim, glazed streaky black below; top of lip glazed; lip and handle zone reserved with line between, glazed below; inscription on exterior.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B3
Curator's comments: Schlotzhauer identifies the sherd as coming from a Type 9C South Ionian cup with everted rim. Type 9C cups correspond to Attic Siana or Gordion cups and find parallels with Hayes' Ionian Cup Type X (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-6) and Vallet and Villard's Ionian Cup type B3 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-8). The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape. Type 5 cups are rare at Naukratis whereas there are numerous examples of Type 9 cups. Both types were common drinking vessels found in Greeks sanctuaries, including the sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 67, no. 825, pl. XXI, no. 825)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 689, no. 473, pl. 23.2.2)
Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 12)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 52, no. 269; p. 108, NAU 63, pl.13j-k)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.718) (Phase 3)
